intro: [WRONG START] McNeillia saxifraga subsp. saxifraga, commonly known as the Sierra Valley stonecrop, is a perennial succulent native to the western United States. It typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils in mountainous regions. The plant features fleshy, thick leaves that are often blue-green in color, adapted to retain moisture. It produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of white and pink during the summer months. Its botanical characteristics make it well-suited for xeriscaping and rock gardens.
